dummyEditorialTeamCurationInfo.name: informed
dummyEditorialTeamCurationInfo.bio: We are a group of dedicated journalists who have written for a variety of respected publications and bring decades of combined experience. Although we have different backgrounds, we believe in a common cause: breaking through filter bubbles and providing readers with the facts and variety of perspectives they need to understand a complex world.

article.otherBriefs: More Articles and Deep Dives from Today

howWeCurateContent.label: How we curate content
howWeCurateContent.title: How we curate content?
howWeCurateContent.text:
We don't believe algorithms alone can provide you with the news and information you need. That's why, in addition to using algorithms for what they're good at, we have _human beings curate our articles,_ experienced journalists who can provide you with the context you need to understand a complex world.

We select our articles from sources _with a proven track record_ of following ethical practices and standards in journalism, and we clearly delineate between news, opinion, and analysis.

When the publications or authors we curate have a _particularly strong political leanings,_ we mention that political perspective in the editor's note so the reader understands the biases they are encountering.

On occasion, we may use sources outside the standard realm of journalism, including _blogs and academic articles._ When we do so, we will clearly inform readers in the editor's note and highlight any political affiliations associated with the sources.

One of our central goals is to _repair a splintered media landscape_ in which people remain in information bubbles, getting news from sources that only reinforce their existing beliefs.

We therefore believe firmly in providing a common platform where a _variety of perspectives_ can be heard and hope, by doing so, we can help renew civil discourse and counteract ever-greater polarization.

We do not shy away from engaging with the most hotly discussed topics of the day. However, we seek to _stay above the fray,_ presenting multiple points of view. While _we strive to be non-partisan,_ this does not mean we don't have our own voice or believe there are some limits to acceptable discourse. We will not lend a platform to those who intentionally spread misinformation or question established science. We will exclude sources that peddle propaganda or seek to foment hatred.
